lexUnit.name: indignant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: filled with annoyance at unfair treatment

sentence.text: Court sounded almost indignant .
She did n't look quite so indignant as she 'd looked before .
Shackel became indignant and said he would fetch a magistrate and complain about the Chief Constable 's attitude , which he did .
Scientists , on both sides of no-man 's land , become bitterly indignant when someone points such external influences out to them .
His tone became more confident , slightly indignant .
` I mean , look at this one , " said the interviewer , becoming quite indignant and picking one of the schools ' letters contemptuously from the pile .
I was extremely indignant .
The RUC men who had conducted the police investigations were fiercely indignant and a senior officer threatened to resign .
The members of the branch were indignant that the government should have planted two spies among them .
Topaz was indignant , some of her fear dissipating .
But I do n't want an indignant boyfriend on my doorstep breathing fire . "
And Victoria now pulled her granddaughter past the indignant old lady , whose face was expressing shock .
` What did you mean , Rachel ? " her mother asked slowly , ignoring her husband 's indignant look .

IN East Germany two men , formerly regarded as untouchable pillars of the old regime , have , rightly or wrongly , become the focus of over-zealous and sometimes bizarre persecution by the legal authorities and an indignant public .
I began to dislike her ; she looked sly and I felt indignant that she 'd spoken to me like that .
` He deserves a proper thrashing , " Cissie protested , fiercely indignant that she had been unable to defend herself while her cowardly brother took delight in whipping her .
Thora is a strong supporter of Help The Aged , and highly indignant that older people are often treated differently the moment they become pensioners .
Jess felt faintly indignant at the remark .
I felt indignant at this casual assumption .
Indignant over suggestions that the Prime Minister has replaced his Jaguar with a Rover , Nigel Lawson can at least draw comfort from the fact that he is a wanted man in the City .
At first Anne felt indignant with Joe , but when she thought it over , realised the good sense of his warning .
The waitress returns , now indignant with her boss for his bought-and-paid-for apathy .
` Good heavens , no , lady " came the indignant reply .
Bellybutton said in an indignant voice , as though my question had impugned McIllvanney 's honour .
She picked up a pen and drew a line through the service charge , then handed the bill to the indignant guest .
Lucien made a small , indignant sound , his arms flailing before he recovered his poise .
Auguste shot him an indignant glance .
She was irritated , indignant .
` Oh ! " she bleated , her voice high and rather indignant .
` Nevil does n't work for me , " he snapped , truly indignant .
After the verdict on Monday , an indignant Cannes president Alain Pedretti described it as ` scandalous " .
` You do these ? " he asked an indignant Auguste .
He watched , felt indignant but also justified because he was right .
